description: Mechanistic questions - probe explicit linguistic and semantic features

questions.question: Does the statement mention a specific person by name?
Does the statement describe an action being performed?
Does the statement express a cause-and-effect relationship?
Does the statement reference a specific time or date?
Does the statement use spatial prepositions (in, on, under, above)?
Does the statement contain explicit numbers?
Does the statement contain explicit negation (not, never, no)?
Does the statement express uncertainty (might, maybe, perhaps)?
Does the statement express obligation (should, must, ought)?
Does the statement contain evaluative language (good, bad)?
Does the statement name a specific emotion (happy, sad, angry)?
Does the statement describe interaction between people?
Does the statement contain quoted speech or dialogue?
Does the statement use first-person pronouns (I, me, my, we)?
Does the statement give instructions or commands?
Does the statement compare two or more things?
Does the statement make moral or ethical judgments?
Does the statement describe someone's intention or purpose?
Does the statement describe concrete, tangible objects?
Does the statement describe someone's identity or role?
